questions.question: What is a Limit??
options: A process that has no relevance to the topic.
A limit is a fundamental concept in calculus that describes the value a function approaches as the input approaches a certain value.
A fictional explanation unrelated to real facts.
A completely unrelated scientific phenomenon.
questions.correctAnswer: A limit is a fundamental concept in calculus that describes the value a function approaches as the input approaches a certain value.

questions.question: What is Limit Notation?
options: The limit of a function f(x) as x approaches a is written as lim x→a f(x).
An outdated concept disproven by modern science.
A process that has no relevance to the topic.
A completely unrelated scientific phenomenon.
questions.correctAnswer: The limit of a function f(x) as x approaches a is written as lim x→a f(x).

questions.question: What is Left-Hand Limit?
options: A fictional explanation unrelated to real facts.
A completely unrelated scientific phenomenon.
A process that has no relevance to the topic.
The limit of a function as it approaches a value from the left side.
questions.correctAnswer: The limit of a function as it approaches a value from the left side.

questions.question: What is Right-Hand Limit?
options: An outdated concept disproven by modern science.
The limit of a function as it approaches a value from the right side.
A fictional explanation unrelated to real facts.
A process that has no relevance to the topic.
questions.correctAnswer: The limit of a function as it approaches a value from the right side.

questions.question: What is Limits at Infinity?
options: Limits can also describe the behavior of functions as x approaches infinity or negative infinity.
A completely unrelated scientific phenomenon.
A fictional explanation unrelated to real facts.
A process that has no relevance to the topic.
questions.correctAnswer: Limits can also describe the behavior of functions as x approaches infinity or negative infinity.

questions.question: When Do Limits Not Exist?
options: A limit does not exist if the left-hand and right-hand limits are not equal, or if the function behaves erratically near the point.
A process that has no relevance to the topic.
A fictional explanation unrelated to real facts.
A completely unrelated scientific phenomenon.
questions.correctAnswer: A limit does not exist if the left-hand and right-hand limits are not equal, or if the function behaves erratically near the point.

An outdated concept disproven by modern science.
A fictional explanation unrelated to real facts.

A completely unrelated scientific phenomenon.
